item.title: Privet hedge weed removal, 11th June
item.description:
Various weeds have been growing in the privet hedge. I have noticed that when the privet hedge is cut, the weeds are not removed. They are left in the hedge and they grow back larger and larger each year. Please review the attached photos, and see the weeds that have collapsed into the public terrace, which is in front of my property. The weeds ruin the look of the privet hedge and look unsightly. Please arrange for them to be removed. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southover, Sundridge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A variously uneven footpath, on a slope, 11th June
item.description:
I am an Australian travelling on a Churchill Fellowship researching Night Time Economies and Safer Cities for Woman Globally. My research was taking me from LA, NYC, London, Paris, Amsterdam and Berlin meeting with Mayoral Offices, City Council and Urban Planners learning how to make cities safer and more inclusive. I was on my way to a meeting with the Mayor of London’s Night Time economy team on foot when I had a horrific accident on one of your footpaths. Not only did it cause a serious injury, it impacted my capacity to continue with my Fellowship, including having to cancel meetings (with the Mayor’s Office included) and created significant financial and emotional stress. This once in a lifetime opportunity that I have worked exceptionally hard to achieve has been greatly undermined by this accident and the incredibly dangerous footpath in this borough is the cause.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Penton Rise, Barnsbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Crashed car on corner of junction, 11th June
item.description:
A car which crashed overnight on Sat 7th June has been left on the corner of Beckenham Lane and Farnaby Road. It has police tape on it, but its position makes it difficult for cars to turn into Farnaby Road, and vehicles coming round the corner from Shortlands village have to pull out to pass it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beckenham Lane, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken branches danger to pedestrians and horses/riders, 11th June
item.description:
Damage to trees along Cocksure lane caused by articulated lorry yesterday (10th June) Various broken branches hanging precariously, posing a hazard to pedestrians, horses, riders, cyclists and cars frequently using this road. There's need to be safely cut down. Resident witnessed large articulated lorry getting stuck by Pond Farm kennels and having to reverse all the way back down to North Cray road, striking trees as it went.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Cocksure Lane, North Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bins not emptied, 11th June
item.description:
The bin at the entrance to Bostal woods at the end of Old farm ave se2 HAS STILL NOT BEEN EMPTIED.this was reported last week .the council man who is supposed to empty them moans about them over flowing but if they were emptied regularly there wouldn’t be a problem .The bins leading from the woods down the green to Wickham lane se2 also need emptying

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): De Lucy Street, Abbey Wood, London
